question_text: A technician is cloning a 1 TB hard drive to a 512 GB SSD. What must be true for the cloning to succeed?
answer_options: The SSD must be the same brand as the original drive
The used space on the source drive must be less than 512 GB
The target SSD must use the NVMe protocol
The drive must be reformatted to FAT32 before cloning
correct_answer: The used space on the source drive must be less than 512 GB
explanation: Cloning transfers all data, so the used space must fit entirely on the new drive, even if the old one was larger.
